p: Currently, the US CDC recommended strategy for identifying individuals with COVID-19 is to test respiratory samples to diagnose the presence of one or several specific nucleic acid targets for SARS-CoV-2 [ 77]. Nasopharyngeal samples are the first choice for swab-based SARS-CoV-2 testing, but samples of the middle turbinate, oropharynx or anterior nostrils are also acceptable [ 78].
